treatment.reference: Methanoculleus hydrogenitrophicus sp. nov., a methanogenic archaeon isolated from wetland soil IJSEM 60:2165-2169
treatment.description: Cells are non-motile, Gram-negative-staining, irregular coccoids. Cells resist lysis by 1% (w/v) SDS. Produces methane only from H2 and CO2. Formate not used for growth or methane formation. Acetate, methanol, ethanol, trimethylamine, isobutanol and 2-propanol did not support growth and methane formation. Acetate is not required for growth; yeast extract stimulates growth. Growth occurs at 18–45 ˚C with optimum growth around 37 ˚C. The pH range is 5.0–8.5, with optimum growth around pH 6.6. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.2 mol%. The type strain, HCT (=CGMCC 1.5146T =JCM 16311T), was isolated from the Zoige wetland, China. Formate, acetate, methanol, ethanol, trimethylamine, isobutanol and 2-propanol (each at 20 mM) did not support growth.
